reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

This game has very few reviews, so i'll post a quickie.

Recounter a spin on the dungeon crawler genre. It's currently in early development (and it shows), but shows a lot of promise and is already fun to play. The general gameplay is divided into three parts: exploration, combat and character management.

Unlike most dungeon crawlers, you don't just walk around with your character peeking around corners. If you're not currently fighting, you're presented with a simple map showing a series of connected rooms. You move by clicking the neighbouring tiles, which in turn reveals more rooms. If there's something worthwhile in a room, you'll have to fight for it. This could be items, allies, shops, healing, food, to name a few. Moving around the map eats up your Hunger stat - more on that in a moment.

When you decide to fight, the game jumps to a 3D view of the room you're currently in. You will see your character/s, the baddies, elements of terrain, and stuff you can later click on to loot. Combat is turn-based and takes place in a classic roguelike fashion - one action at a time. Some actions are faster, some are slower, thus quickening or delaying your next turn (think ADoM" and energy costs). All charaters have 3 floating bars at their feet
recommended: Stamina and time until next turn. Each weapon has two different attacks - heavy and light - which can target specific body parts
hoursPlayed: thus inflicting various flavours of boo-boo upon your enemies (and you). The specific effects of getting hit and some other actions (like running) aren't described in the game yet
helpfulPercent: you just have to figure that stuff out by yourself.\n\nCharacter management is rather developed at this stage. You manage your Health (which keeps you alive)
votesTotal: and the money-thing called "Ice". If you deplete your health
votesFunny: you die. If your Hunger drops below a certain threshold
commentsCount: you suffer severe penalty to stats. Without Ice you're weak. Speaking of Ice - you gather it by killing enemies
column16: looting stuff and disassembling items at your inventory screen. In turn
column17: it lets you upgrade your stats and equipment. Also serves as currency when you find a shop.\n\nRecounter is in early development. That means unfinished interface (everything is accessible and usable
column20: and balance issues (i.e. I cleared the first dungeon level just fine and then I got completely massacred in the first room of the second floor). The core mechanics are there
column21: and the game is enjoyable already
column22: which is something notable in an early-access game. Recounter is dirt cheap
column25: so if you're a fan of the genre
column26: I suggest supporting the creator. And if you're skeptical about early access
column27: just pay close attention to the title
column28:
it may grow into something great.


Edit: I don't know why it says i received a free key. I'm pretty sure I didn't tick the box and I bought the game myself."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Turn-Based Rogue-Like RPGhttps://youtu.be/6DmSeUWk6i8
+ Very challenging, Your progress resets if you die
+ A nice loot system / attributes / equipment system.
+ The dark background music / ambient sounds fit very well in the game.
+ When attacking you can target different body parts which have varying degrees of effect, like if you hit their arms it may lower their accuracy.
+ Graphically it looks pretty good especially for a turn-based game

This game is in EARLY ACCESS, so don't take these points too seriously
- The User Interface and Map needs improvements, currently it looks far too basic and doesn't fit well with the gameplay
- The Story is very vague, i mean you really have no idea where you are who you are or what's going on.
- Early on I feel like it's far too difficult to obtain / make healing items
- I think you should be able to move and attack in the same turn...I found that it's better to just sit and wait for someone to get close rather than move at all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First thing to keep in mind is that this isn't a full release yet.

Rencounter is a fun turn based RPG game that is similar to an old school RPG game in many ways. It incorparates many different ways of attacking with grenades, guns, and melee weapons. You can have multiple characters in your party as well. Some things are still a little rusty, such as the lack of instructions and tutorial on what to do but it's easy enough to figure out! I reccomend checking this game out and if you're looking for a video explaining that check out this link.

https://youtu.be/zIX6uF_MqyA
voteText: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game for a really  tough guys , who are ready to  try and die,  to try and die , again and again.
Just wild slash, no mercy, no knowledge - Where are u from? What is going on? Pure war and fight for crumbs of HP and loot)))
First  four or five deaths, loosing loot and chars  are enraging. But then u thinks I’ll do it. Yes I’ll do it.

Pros:
-    Fine picture
-    Each attempt like a lottery, like a real life
-    Addictive game
-    Every time u think this is the last) But trying again
-    For me the game is ready for 90 percents
Cons:
-    I'l prefer to see buttons and map more attractive than circles and squares
-    Not clear system of counts in battles
-    Not all items have normal description
-    Some tutorial makes it more pleasure to play

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Rencounter ReviewRencounter was amazing. It had everything I loved the why you moved with the side bar. It had stuff like I loved how the movement had side tab. I would of like you using WASD to move. But I thought that feature was super cool. I also liked the where you could strike. But I wish you can add QWER as your attack powers. Their also should be an online mode I really liked the game. I would just add those things and your game will be perfect. I loved how the anmation how the charcter moves. But I felt like the charcters can move faster because I feel like thats what will fix the integrity of your game. Music is very amazing and I love it. I would love to work with you on this game with grapics with point of making them look sharper and higher quailty.

#### PROS ####
Loved How Charcters Moves
Music Was Amzing
Loved the side menu were you controlled Everything
#### CONS ####
Moving with WASD
Very Laggy
Attacking with QWER
In discloseur I got this game in exchange for a review.

From,
Ethan Seth Klein

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well ,  for the first 20 minute I enjoy the game very much
Just after I died in the game I realise that all the drops and items that I earned , including the character is gone .
I have to start all over again . at the moment , I immediately lose my mind .

Pros :
- Game is nice
- Fastpaced
-  LOOKS   easy
- Strategic game ( Challenges your  ♥♥♥♥ing mind   )
- Graphic is OK

Cons :
- No tutorial
- Didn't tell you that you'll have to start all over again when you die.
- The on screen buttons/options is pretty outdated (   UGLY  )
- The gameplay is more suitable on mobile phone .

Overall 8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Too Early to Recommend this EA Title b/c

Graphically and thematically very bland...
UI is within reach of wtf territory of bad....
Combat is underdeveloped at this point...
No Tutorial.....
Optmization needed but that phase is likely far away.....
Looks like this is a first effort or an early solo effort for the developer....

I however did not refund and will recommend checking back buy or hitting the follow button at top of the page b/c...

Dungeon-Crawling Squad Tactics Rougelikes need to exist....
Price wise this isn't going to break your bank...
Potential to get better and watching baby games grow up to be big kids is what Early Access should be about....
If this is a first effort or even an early one it's not a bad effort for a game demo and I am curious to see what's next.....
Recounter might be the worst name for a game I have played this year....since my current favorite mobile game is the worst named game of last year (Mavenfall) there could be a trend developing and we should all stay tuned.

I will check in and update now and then if necessary.
